author: James Martin
method: In a clean bowl, whisk together the egg yolks, sugar, lemon juice and vanilla pod over a saucepan of barely simmering water, until thickened.  Fold through the double cream into the bowl, and then gently pour the mixture into a tall glass.  For the spun sugar, in a small frying pan melt the sugar over a medium heat and when it turns into a deep golden colour, remove from the heat and use a fork to flick back an forth over a greased rolling pin. To serve, gather the sugar strands together into a ball and top the posset with it.
ingredients: 3 free-range egg yolks,  55g/2oz caster sugar,  1 lemon, juice only ,  1 vanilla pod, split open,  142ml/5fl oz pot double cream, whipped,  30g/1oz caster sugar
